attributes.action: Introduction of symbolic prices for public services / community projects
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Introduction of symbolic prices for public services / community projects

Dear Sir or madam

due the situation of the public finances - the fairest way to raise money without increasing taxes is by introducing Pay-by-use symbolic prices widely used in Europe but not in the UK.

First, symbolic prices are very low fares that cover basic cost for services without making a profit for the service provider helping run the service and providing stability over the long term while avoiding the abusing use of the service.

First, museums should charge a £1 or £2 per person to cover basic services. Schools children should have a 10 times ticket per week to cover genuine school trips. The BBC license fee should be symbolic – say £20 per year (compare with any other country very high). 

Similar use of symbolic prices should be identified in sectors such as schools, libraries, hospitals, transport, social benefits, etc. A study should be carried out to identify areas where these symbolic prices make sense and are convenient.
